landing.big-heading-1: Learn to code â€” for free.
landing.h2-heading: Since 2014, more than 40,000 freeCodeCamp.org graduates have gotten jobs at tech companies including:
landing.h2-heading-b: More than 100,000 freeCodeCamp.org graduates have gotten jobs at tech companies including:
landing.hero-img-description: freeCodeCamp students at a local study group in South Korea.
landing.hero-img-alt: A group of people, including a White man, a Black woman, and an Asian woman, gathered around a laptop.
landing.hero-img-uis: A group of screenshots showing the freeCodeCamp editor interface on both a mobile and desktop device and a certification.

testimonials.heading: Here is what our alumni say about freeCodeCamp:

shawn.testimony: "It's scary to change careers. I only gained confidence that I could code by working through the hundreds of hours of free lessons on freeCodeCamp. Within a year I had a six-figure job as a Software Engineer. freeCodeCamp changed my life."

sarah.testimony: "freeCodeCamp was the gateway to my career as a software developer. The well-structured curriculum took my coding knowledge from a total beginner level to a very confident level. It was everything I needed to land my first dev job at an amazing company."

emma.testimony: "I've always struggled with learning JavaScript. I've taken many courses but freeCodeCamp's course was the one which stuck. Studying JavaScript as well as data structures and algorithms on freeCodeCamp gave me the skills and confidence I needed to land my dream job as a software engineer at Spotify."

landing.core-certs-heading: Earn free verified certifications with freeCodeCamp's core curriculum:
landing.interview-prep-heading: Prepare for the developer interview job search:

faqs.question: What exactly is freeCodeCamp?
answer: freeCodeCamp is a community of people from all around the world who are learning to code together. We're a 501(c)(3) public charity.

faqs.question: How will freeCodeCamp help me learn to code?
answer: You will learn to code by building dozens of projects, step-by-step, right in your browser, code editor, or mobile app.
You will also earn free verified certifications along the way.

faqs.question: Is freeCodeCamp really free?
answer: Yes. Every aspect of freeCodeCamp is 100% free. The courses, the projects, and even the certifications.

faqs.question: Can freeCodeCamp help me get a job as a software developer?
answer: Yes. Every year, thousands of people who join the freeCodeCamp community get their first software developer job.

faqs.question: What skills will I learn?
answer: You will learn the skills most developers use on the job: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, Linux, Git, and SQL, and more. You'll also learn how to use powerful libraries for web development, mobile app development, data science, and artificial intelligence.

faqs.question: How long does it take to learn all this?
answer: freeCodeCamp is self-paced. Realistically, it may take several years of practicing coding to learn these skills well enough to get a job as a software engineer. Don't quit school or your day job until you feel ready.

faqs.question: How do I get started?
answer: If you're a beginner, you should start at the beginning of the freeCodeCamp core curriculum. If you're more advanced, we still recommend starting at the beginning, but you can skip to whatever area you wish.

faqs.question: How do I earn the free verified certifications?
answer: For each certification, you need to build its 5 certification projects, and get all of the project tests to pass to be able to claim your certification.

faqs.question: I don't see [name of tool] in the freeCodeCamp core curriculum.
answer: Aside from the freeCodeCamp core curriculum, We have thousands of free, full-length books, courses, and programming tutorials. We almost certainly teach whatever programming tools you want to learn. Just use the search bar.

danger.heading: Danger Zone
danger.be-careful: Please be careful. Changes in this section are permanent.
danger.delete-p1: This will really delete all your data, including all your progress and account information.
danger.delete-p2: We won't be able to recover any of it for you later, even if you change your mind.
danger.delete-p3: If there's something we could do better, send us an email instead and we'll do our best: <0>{{email}}</0>
danger.nevermind: Nevermind, I don't want to delete my account
danger.certain: I am 100% certain. Delete everything related to this account
danger.reset-p1: This will permanently delete and reset all of the following:
danger.reset-item-1: Your progress through each step/challenge (all completed challenges will be lost)
danger.reset-item-2: Any saved code, including partially completed challenges, and certification project code
danger.reset-p2: You will effectively be set back to the very first day you signed up.
danger.reset-p3: We won't be able to recover any of it for you later, even if you change your mind.
danger.nevermind-2: Nevermind, I don't want to delete all of my progress
danger.reset-confirm: Reset everything. I want to start from the beginning
danger.verify-reset-text: I agree that all progress will be lost
danger.verify-delete-text: I agree to delete my account

email.missing: You do not have an email associated with this account.
email.heading: Email Settings
email.not-verified: Your email has not been verified.
email.check: Please check your email, or <0>request a new verification email here</0>.

honesty.p1: Before you can claim a verified certification, you must accept our Academic Honesty Pledge, which reads:
honesty.p2: "I understand that plagiarism means copying someone elseâ€™s work and presenting the work as if it were my own, without clearly attributing the original author."
honesty.p3: "I understand that plagiarism is an act of intellectual dishonesty, and that people usually get kicked out of university or fired from their jobs if they get caught plagiarizing."
honesty.p4: "Aside from using open source libraries such as jQuery and Bootstrap, and short snippets of code which are clearly attributed to their original author, 100% of the code in my projects was written by me, or along with another person going through the freeCodeCamp curriculum with whom I was pair programming in real time."
honesty.p5: "I pledge that I did not plagiarize any of my freeCodeCamp.org work. I understand that freeCodeCamp.orgâ€™s team will audit my projects to confirm this."
honesty.p6: In the situations where we discover instances of unambiguous plagiarism, we will replace the person in questionâ€™s certification with a message that "Upon review, this account has been flagged for academic dishonesty."
honesty.p7: As an academic institution that grants achievement-based certifications, we take academic honesty very seriously. If you have any questions about this policy, or suspect that someone has violated it, you can email <0>{{email}}</0> and we will investigate.

profile.you-change-privacy: You need to change your privacy setting in order for your portfolio to be seen by others. This is a preview of how your portfolio will look when made public.
profile.username-change-privacy: {{username}} needs to change their privacy setting in order for you to view their portfolio.

footer.tax-exempt-status: freeCodeCamp is a donor-supported tax-exempt 501(c)(3) charitable organization (United States Federal Tax Identification Number: 82-0779546).
footer.mission-statement: Our mission: to help people learn to code for free. We accomplish this by creating thousands of videos, articles, and interactive coding lessons - all freely available to the public.
footer.donation-initiatives: Donations to freeCodeCamp go toward our education initiatives, and help pay for servers, services, and staff.
footer.donate-text: You can <1>make a tax-deductible donation here</1>.

learn.heading: Welcome to freeCodeCamp's curriculum.
learn.start-at-beginning: If you are new to coding, we recommend you <0>start at the beginning</0>.

read-this.heading: Please slow down and read this.
read-this.p1: freeCodeCamp is a proven path to your first software developer job.
read-this.p2: More than 40,000 people have gotten developer jobs after completing this â€“ including at big companies like Google and Microsoft.
read-this.p3: If you are new to programming, we recommend you start at the beginning and earn these certifications in order.
read-this.p4: To earn each certification, build its 5 required projects and get all their tests to pass.
read-this.p5: You can add these certifications to your rÃ©sumÃ© or LinkedIn. But more important than the certifications is the practice you get along the way.
read-this.p6: If you feel overwhelmed, that is normal. Programming is hard.
read-this.p7: Practice is the key. Practice, practice, practice.
read-this.p8: And this curriculum will give you thousands of hours of hands-on programming practice.
read-this.p9: And if you want to learn more math and computer science theory, we also have thousands of hours of video courses on <0>freeCodeCamp's YouTube channel</0>.
read-this.p10: If you want to get a developer job or freelance clients, programming skills will be just part of the puzzle. You also need to build your personal network and your reputation as a developer.
read-this.p11: You can do this on LinkedIn and GitHub, and also on <0>the freeCodeCamp forum</0>.

gitpod.intro: This course runs in a virtual Linux machine using Gitpod. Follow these instructions to start the course:
gitpod.step-1: <0>Create a GitHub</0> account if you don't have one
gitpod.step-3: Login to Gitpod with your GitHub account if you aren't already
gitpod.step-4: Once the virtual Linux machine is finished loading, start the CodeRoad extension by:
gitpod.step-5: Clicking the "hamburger" menu near the top left of the VSCode window,
gitpod.step-9: Follow the instructions in CodeRoad to complete the course
gitpod.continue-project: Clicking the button below will start a new project. If you have previously started the {{course}} course, go to <0>your Gitpod dashboard</0> to continue.
gitpod.logout-warning: If you log out of freeCodeCamp before you complete the entire {{course}} course, your progress will not be saved to your freeCodeCamp account.

learn.submit-public-url: When you have completed the project, save all the required files into a public repository and submit the URL to it below.

learn.runs-in-vm: The project runs in a virtual machine, complete the user stories described in there and get all the tests to pass to finish step 1.

ms.link-signin: To complete this challenge, you must first link your Microsoft username to your freeCodeCamp account. Sign in to link your Microsoft username.
ms.linked: The Microsoft account with username "{{ msUsername }}" is currently linked to your freeCodeCamp account. If this is not your Microsoft username, remove the link.
ms.unlinked: To complete this challenge, you must first link your Microsoft username to your freeCodeCamp account by following these instructions:
ms.link-li-1: Using a browser where you are logged into your Microsoft account, go to <0>https://learn.microsoft.com/users/me/transcript</0>
ms.link-li-2: Find and click the "Share link" button.
ms.link-li-3: If you do not have a transcript link, click the "Create link" button to create one.
ms.link-li-4: Click the "Copy link" button to copy the transcript URL.
ms.link-li-5: Paste the URL into the input below, it should look similar to this: <0>https://learn.microsoft.com/LOCALE/users/USERNAME/transcript/ID</0>
ms.link-li-6: Click "Link Account" to link your Microsoft username.
ms.invalid-transcript: Your transcript link is not correct, it should have the following form: <1>https://learn.microsoft.com/LOCALE/users/USERNAME/transcript/ID</1> - check the UPPERCASE items in your link are correct.

donate.help-us-develop: Help us develop free professional programming certifications for all.
donate.credit-card-2: Or donate with a credit card:
donate.need-email: We need a valid email address to which we can send your donation tax receipt.
donate.went-wrong: Something went wrong processing your donation. Your card has not been charged.
donate.valid-info: Please enter valid email address, credit card number, and expiration date.
donate.valid-email: Please enter a valid email address.
donate.valid-card: Please enter valid credit card number and expiration date.
donate.email-receipt: Email (we'll send you a tax-deductible donation receipt):
donate.need-help: Need help with your current or past donations?
donate.forward-receipt: Forward a copy of your donation receipt to donors@freecodecamp.org and tell us how we can help.
donate.efficiency: freeCodeCamp is a highly efficient education charity.
donate.why-donate-1: When you donate to freeCodeCamp, you help people learn new skills and provide for their families.
donate.why-donate-2: You also help us create new resources for you to use to expand your own technology skills.
donate.bigger-donation: Want to make a bigger one-time donation, mail us a check, or give in other ways?
donate.other-ways: Here are many <0>other ways you can support our charity's mission</0>.
donate.if-support-further: If you want to support our charity further, please consider <0>making a one-time donation</0>, <1>sending us a check</1>, or <2>learning about other ways you could support our charity.</2>
donate.failed-pay: Uh - oh. It looks like your transaction didn't go through. Could you please try again?
donate.try-another-method: Uh - oh. It looks like your transaction didn't go through. Could you please try another payment method?
donate.only-you: Only you can see this message. Congratulations on earning this certification. It's no easy task. Running freeCodeCamp isn't easy either. Nor is it cheap. Help us help you and many other people around the world. Make a tax-deductible supporting donation to our charity today.
donate.get-help: How can I get help with my donations?
donate.very-transparent: Very. We have a Platinum transparency rating from GuideStar.org.
donate.download-irs: You can <0>download our IRS Determination Letter here</0>.
donate.download-990: You can <0>download our most recent 990 (annual tax report) here</0>.
donate.fcc-budget: freeCodeCamp's budget is much smaller than most comparable charities. We haven't brought in professional fundraisers. Instead, Quincy does everything himself.
donate.help-millions: However, on a budget of only a few hundred thousand dollars per year, we have been able to help millions of people.
donate.how-one-time: How can I make a one-time donation?
donate.one-time: If you'd prefer to make one-time donations, you can support freeCodeCamp's mission whenever you have cash to spare. You can use <0>this link to donate whatever amount feels right through PayPal</0>.
donate.wire-transfer: You can also send money to freeCodeCamp directly through a wire transfer. If you need our wire details, email Quincy at quincy@freecodecamp.org
donate.does-crypto: Does freeCodeCamp accept donations in Bitcoin or other cryptocurrencies?
donate.yes-cryptocurrency: Yes. Please email Quincy at quincy@freecodecamp.org and he can send you freeCodeCamp's wallet information. He can also provide you with a donation receipt if you need one for your taxes.
donate.can-check: Can I mail a physical check?
donate.yes-check: Yes, we would welcome a check. You can mail it to us at:
donate.how-matching-gift: How can I set up matching gifts from my employer, or payroll deductions?
donate.employers-vary: This varies from employer to employer, and our charity is already listed in many of the big donation-matching databases.
donate.some-volunteer: Some people are able to volunteer for freeCodeCamp and their employer matches by donating a fixed amount per hour they volunteer. Other employers will match any donations the donors make up to a certain amount
donate.help-matching-gift: If you need help with this, please email Quincy directly: quincy@freecodecamp.org
donate.how-endowment: How can I set up an Endowment Gift to freeCodeCamp.org?
donate.endowment: This would be a huge help. Since this is a more manual process, Quincy can help walk you through it personally. Please email him directly at quincy@freecodecamp.org.
donate.how-legacy: How can I set up a Legacy gift to freeCodeCamp.org?
donate.we-honored: We would be honored to put such a gift to good use helping people around the world learn to code. Depending on where you live, this may also be tax exempt.
donate.legacy-gift-message: I give, devise, and bequeath [the sum of _____ USD (or other currency) OR _____ percent of the rest and residue of my estate] to freeCodeCamp.org (Free Code Camp, Inc. tax identification number 82-0779546), a charitable corporation organized under the laws of the State of Delaware, United States, currently located at 3905 Hedgcoxe Rd, PO Box 250352, Plano, Texas, 75025 United States, to be used for its general charitable purposes at its discretion.
donate.thank-wikimedia: We would like to thank the Wikimedia Foundation for providing this formal language for us to use.
donate.legacy-gift-questions: If you have any questions about this process, please email Quincy at quincy@freecodecamp.org.
donate.how-stock: How can I donate stock to freeCodeCamp.org?
donate.welcome-stock: We would welcome your stock donations. Please email Quincy directly and he can help you with this, and share our charity's brokerage account details: quincy@freecodecamp.org.
donate.how-receipt: Can I get a donation receipt so that I can deduct my donation from my taxes?
donate.just-forward: Absolutely. Just forward the receipt from your transaction to donors@freecodecamp.org, tell us you'd like a receipt and any special instructions you may have, and we'll reply with a receipt for you.
donate.how-update: I set up a monthly donation, but I need to update or stop the monthly recurrence. How can I do this?
donate.take-care-of-this: Just forward one of your monthly donation receipts to donors@freecodecamp.org and tell us what you'd like us to do. We'll take care of this for you and send you confirmation.
donate.anything-else: Is there anything else I can learn about donating to freeCodeCamp.org?
donate.other-support: If there is some other way you'd like to support our charity and its mission that isn't listed here, or if you have any questions at all, please email Quincy at quincy@freecodecamp.org.
donate.bear-progress-alt: Illustration of an adorable teddy bear with a pleading expression holding an empty money jar.
donate.bear-completion-alt: Illustration of an adorable teddy bear holding a large trophy.
donate.flying-bear: Illustration of an adorable teddy bear wearing a graduation cap and flying with a Supporter badge.
donate.crucial-contribution: Your contribution will be crucial in creating resources that empower millions of people to learn new skills and support their families.
donate.support-benefits-3: Your profile image will get a golden halo around it
donate.support-benefits-4: You'll gain access to special Supporter Discord channels - <0>join our Discord</0> and use the <1>/supporter</1> command to get access
donate.support-benefits-5: And more benefits to come in 2024
donate.exclusive-features: Here is the list of exclusive features for you as a Supporter:
donate.your-donation-helps-followings: Your donation makes the following initiatives possible:
donate.current-initiatives-1: Creating new JavaScript and Python curricula
donate.current-initiatives-3: Translating our curriculum and tutorials into 32 languages
donate.current-initiatives-4: Creating a free accredited computer science bachelor's degree
donate.community-achivements-2: Published <0>1,045</0> text-based coding tutorials and <0>20</0> free books through freeCodeCamp Press.
donate.community-achivements-3: Merged <0>2,753</0> code contributions into our open source repositories on GitHub
donate.community-achivements-4: Translated <0>2,106,203</0> words to make our curriculum and tutorials more accessible to speakers of many world languages
donate.as-you-see: As you can see, we're getting things done. So you can rest assured that we'll put your donations to good use.
donate.get-benefits: Get the benefits and the knowledge that youâ€™re helping our charity change education for the better. Become a supporter today.
donate.animation-description: This is a 20 second animated advertisement to encourage campers to become supporters of freeCodeCamp. The animation starts with a teddy bear who becomes a supporter. As a result, distracting pop-ups disappear and the bear gets to complete all of its goals. Then, it graduates and becomes an education super hero helping people around the world.
donate.animation-countdown: This animation will stop after {{secondsRemaining}} seconds.

misc.offline: You appear to be offline, your progress may not be saved
misc.server-offline: The server could not be reached and your progress may not be saved. Please contact <0>support</0> if this message persists
misc.keep-coding: Whatever you go on to, keep coding!
misc.brand-new-account: Welcome to your brand new freeCodeCamp account. Let's get started.
misc.duplicate-account-warning: If you meant to sign into an existing account instead of creating this account, <0>click here to delete this account</0> and try another email address.
misc.quincy: - Quincy Larson, the teacher who founded freeCodeCamp.org
misc.email-blast: By the way, each Friday I send an email with 5 links about programming and computer science. I send these to about 6 million people. Would you like me to send this to you, too?
misc.iframe-alert: Normally this link would bring you to another website! It works. This is a link to: {{externalLink}}
misc.iframe-form-submit-alert: Normally this form would be submitted! It works. This will be submitted to: {{externalLink}}
misc.slow-load-msg: Looks like this is taking longer than usual, please try refreshing the page.
misc.navigation-warning: If you leave this page, you will lose your progress. Are you sure?

icons.avatar-2: An avatar coding with a laptop

aria.move-preview-to-new-window: Move the preview to a new window and focus it
aria.move-preview-to-main-window: Move the preview to this window and close the external preview window
aria.show-preview: Show the preview in this window
aria.open-preview-in-new-window: Open the preview in a new window and focus it
aria.rsa-checkbox: I have tried the Read-Search-Ask method
aria.similar-questions-checkbox: I have searched for similar questions that have already been answered on the forum

flash.honest-first: To claim a certification, you must first agree to our academic honesty policy
flash.really-weird: Something really weird happened, if it happens again, please consider raising an issue on https://github.com/freeCodeCamp/freeCodeCamp/issues/new
flash.generic-error: Something went wrong. Please try again in a moment or contact support@freecodecamp.org if the error persists.
flash.went-wrong: Something went wrong, please check and try again
flash.account-deleted: Your account has been successfully deleted
flash.not-authorized: You are not authorized to continue on this route
flash.could-not-find: We couldn't find what you were looking for. Please check and try again
flash.wrong-updating: Something went wrong updating your account. Please check and try again
flash.updated-about-me: We have updated your personal information
flash.updated-socials: We have updated your social links
flash.updated-sound: We have updated your sound settings
flash.keyboard-shortcut-updated: We have updated your keyboard shortcuts settings
flash.subscribe-to-quincy-updated: We have updated your subscription to Quincy's email
flash.email-valid: Your email has successfully been changed, happy coding!
flash.bad-challengeId: currentChallengeId is not a valid challenge ID
flash.username-used: Username is already associated with this account
flash.username-taken: Username is already associated with a different account
flash.username-updated: We have updated your username to {{username}}
flash.privacy-updated: We have updated your privacy settings
flash.could-not-logout: We could not log you out, please try again in a moment
flash.email-encoded-wrong: The email encoded in the link is incorrectly formatted
flash.oops-not-right: Oops, something is not right, please request a fresh link to sign in / sign up
flash.expired-link: Looks like the link you clicked has expired, please request a fresh link, to sign in
flash.signin-success: Success! You have signed in to your account. Happy Coding!
flash.social-auth-gone: We are moving away from social authentication for privacy reasons. Next time we recommend using your email address: {{email}} to sign in instead.
flash.name-needed: We need your name so we can put it on your certification. Add your name to your account settings and click the save button. Then we can issue your certification.
flash.incomplete-steps: It looks like you have not completed the necessary steps. Please complete the required projects to claim the {{name}} Certification.
flash.already-claimed: It looks like you already have claimed the {{name}} Certification
flash.cert-claim-success: @{{username}}, you have successfully claimed the {{name}} Certification! Congratulations on behalf of the freeCodeCamp.org team!
flash.wrong-name: Something went wrong with the verification of {{name}}, please try again. If you continue to receive this error, you can send a message to support@freeCodeCamp.org to get help.
flash.username-not-found: We could not find a user with the username "{{username}}"
flash.add-name: This user needs to add their name to their account in order for others to be able to view their certification.
flash.not-eligible: This user is not eligible for freeCodeCamp.org certifications at this time.
flash.profile-private: {{username}} has chosen to make their profile private. They will need to make their profile public in order for others to be able to view their certification.
flash.certs-private: {{username}} has chosen to make their certifications private. They will need to make their certifications public in order for others to be able to view them.
flash.not-honest: {{username}} has not yet agreed to our Academic Honesty Pledge.
flash.user-not-certified: It looks like user {{username}} is not {{cert}} certified
flash.invalid-challenge: That does not appear to be a valid challenge submission
flash.no-links-provided: You have not provided the valid links for us to inspect your work.
flash.provide-username: Check if you have provided a username and a report
flash.report-sent: A report was sent to the team with {{email}} in copy
flash.certificate-missing: The certification you tried to view does not exist
flash.create-token-err: An error occurred while creating your user token
flash.delete-token-err: An error occurred while deleting your user token
flash.token-created: You have successfully created a new user token.
flash.token-deleted: Your user token has been deleted.
flash.start-project-err: Something went wrong trying to start the project. Please try again.
flash.complete-project-first: You must complete the project first.
flash.local-code-save-error: Oops, your code did not save, your browser's local storage may be full.
flash.local-code-saved: Saved! Your code was saved to your browser's local storage.
flash.timeline-private: {{username}} has chosen to make their timeline private. They will need to make their timeline public in order for others to be able to view their certification.
flash.code-saved: Your code was saved to the database. It will be here when you return.
flash.code-save-error: An error occurred trying to save your code.
flash.code-save-less: Slow Down! Your code was not saved. Try again in a few seconds.
flash.challenge-save-too-big: Sorry, you cannot save your code. Your code is {{user-size}} bytes. We allow a maximum of {{max-size}} bytes. Please make your code smaller and try again or request assistance on https://forum.freecodecamp.org
flash.challenge-submit-too-big: Sorry, you cannot submit your code. Your code is {{user-size}} bytes. We allow a maximum of {{max-size}} bytes. Please make your code smaller and try again or request assistance on https://forum.freecodecamp.org
flash.invalid-update-flag: You are attempting to access forbidden resources. Please request assistance on https://forum.freecodecamp.org if this is a valid request.
flash.generate-exam-error: An error occurred trying to generate your exam.

transcript.link-err-1: Please include a Microsoft transcript URL in the request.
transcript.link-err-2: Something went wrong trying to get your transcript from Microsoft.
transcript.link-err-3: A username was not found in your Microsoft transcript.
transcript.link-err-4: That Microsoft username is being used by another freeCodeCamp account.
transcript.link-err-5: Something went wrong trying to save your Microsoft account.
transcript.link-err-6: Something went wrong trying to link your Microsoft username to your freeCodeCamp account.
transcript.linked: Your Microsoft username has been linked to your freeCodeCamp account.
transcript.unlinked: The link to your Microsoft username has been removed.
transcript.unlink-err: Something went wrong trying to remove the link to your Microsoft username.

profile.err: We could not find a Microsoft user ID for Microsoft user "{{msUsername}}"

trophy.err-1: We could not find a Microsoft username associated with your freeCodeCamp account.
trophy.err-2: You are trying to submit a challenge that does not appear to be a trophy challenge.
trophy.err-3: We could not get your Microsoft profile from your Microsoft ID.
trophy.err-4: It appears that the Microsoft user "{{msUsername}}" has not earned this trophy.
trophy.err-5: Something went wrong trying to verify your trophy. Please check and try again.
trophy.err-6: It looks like your Microsoft account might be private. Set it to public and try again.
trophy.verified: Your trophy from Microsoft's learning platform was verified.

survey.err-1: The survey submitted is not in the correct format.
survey.err-2: It looks like you have already completed this survey.
survey.err-3: Something went wrong trying to save your survey.
survey.success: Thank you. Your survey was submitted.

flash.classroom-mode-updated: We have updated your classroom mode settings

validation.max-characters: There is a maximum limit of 288 characters, you have {{charsLeft}} left
validation.same-email: This email is the same as your current email
validation.invalid-email: We could not validate your email correctly, please ensure it is correct
validation.email-mismatch: Both new email addresses must be the same
validation.invalid-url: We could not validate your URL correctly, please ensure it is correct
validation.invalid-protocol: URL must start with http or https
validation.url-not-image: URL must link directly to an image file
validation.editor-url: Remember to submit the Live App URL.
validation.http-url: An unsecure (http) URL cannot be used.
validation.own-work-url: Remember to submit your own work.
validation.publicly-visible-url: Remember to submit a publicly visible app URL.
validation.ms-learn-link: Please use a valid Microsoft Learn trophy link.
validation.path-url: You probably want to submit the root path i.e. https://example.com, not https://example.com/path
validation.source-code-link-required: Remember to submit the link to your source code.

certification.fulltext: <0>This certifies that</0> <1>{{user}}</1> <2>successfully completed the</2> <3>{{title}}</3> <4>Developer Certification on {{time}}</4> <5>representing approximately {{completionTime}} hours of work</5>
certification.fulltextNoHours: <0>This certifies that</0> <1>{{user}}</1> <2>successfully completed the</2> <3>{{title}}</3> <4>Developer Certification on {{time}}</4>

project.heading-legacy-full-stack: As part of this Legacy Full Stack certification, {{user}} completed the following certifications:
project.heading-exam: As part of this certification, {{user}} passed the following exam:
project.heading: As part of this certification, {{user}} built the following projects and got all automated test suites to pass:
project.no-solution: error displaying solution, email support@freeCodeCamp.org to get help.
project.footnote: If you suspect that any of these projects violate the <2>academic honesty policy</2>, please <5>report this to our team</5>.

certification-card.title: Claim Your Certification
certification-card.intro: Complete the following steps to claim and view your {{i18nCertText}}
certification-card.set-name: Set your name, and make it public
certification-card.set-certs-public: Set your certification settings to public
certification-card.set-profile-public: Set your profile settings to public

forum-help.describe:
Describe your issue in detail here. Example: 
My h1 element is missing an opening tag. Need help checking my code. 
OR 
My for loop runs infinitely. How to prevent this?
forum-help.too-long-one: The challenge seed code and/or your solution exceeded the maximum length we can port over from the challenge.
forum-help.too-long-two: You will need to take an additional step here so the code you wrote presents in an easy to read format.
forum-help.too-long-three: Please copy/paste all the editor code showing in the challenge from where you just linked.
forum-help.add-code-one: Replace these two sentences with your copied code.
forum-help.add-code-two: Please leave the ``` line above and the ``` line below,
forum-help.add-code-three: because they allow your code to properly format in the post.

user-token.title: User Token
user-token.create-p1: It looks like you don't have a user token. Create one to save your progress on this section
user-token.create-p2: Create a user token to save your progress on the curriculum sections that use a virtual machine.
user-token.delete-p1: Your user token is used to save your progress on curriculum sections that use a virtual machine. If you suspect it has been compromised, you can delete it without losing any progress. A new one will be created automatically the next time you open a project.
user-token.delete-p2: If you suspect your token has been compromised, you can delete it to make it unusable. Progress on previously submitted lessons will not be lost.
user-token.delete-p3: You will need to create a new token to save future progress on the curriculum sections that use a virtual machine.
user-token.no-thanks: No thanks, I would like to keep my token
user-token.yes-please: Yes please, I would like to delete my token

signout.heading: Sign out of your account
signout.p1: Warning: If you continue, your progress will no longer be saved.
signout.p2: This action will sign you out of your account on this device and browser session only. Please confirm if you would like to proceed.
signout.certain: Yes, sign out of my account
signout.nevermind: Nevermind, I don't want to sign out

staging-warning.heading: Warning: This is an early access test deployment
staging-warning.p1: We welcome you to try this platform in a test-only mode and get early access to upcoming features. Sometimes these changes are referred to as next, beta, staging, etc. interchangeably.
staging-warning.p2: We thank you for reporting bugs that you encounter and help in making freeCodeCamp.org better.
staging-warning.p3: Your progress MAY NOT be saved on your next visit, and any certifications claimed on this deployment are not valid. Learn more by <0>following this link</0>.

q2.q: Prior to this course, how experienced were you with .NET and C#?

misc.two-questions: Congratulations on getting this far. Before you can start the exam, please answer these two short survey questions.
